Package fr.cnrs.iees.identity.impl

Class LocalScope

java.lang.Object
fr.cnrs.iees.identity.impl.LocalScope
All Implemented Interfaces:
IdentityScope
Direct Known Subclasses:
ResettableLocalScope
public class LocalScope extends Object implements IdentityScope

A local scope, keeping track of all its ids. Works with SimpleIdentity.

Every time a new Identity instance is created, its identifier is recorded in an internal list. All later instantiations check that the new identifier does not yet exist in this list and modify it (by adding an increasing number suffix) if it does before generating the new instance. As a result, this scope implementation becomes slow with increasing numbers of Identity instances and should only be used with small sets of identifiers. The method used to modify proposed identifiers is UniqueString.makeString(String, Set).

Its advantage is that you can provide explicit identifiers through the newId(proposedId) method, thus creating more user-friendly identifier than other scope implementations.

Author:
Jacques Gignoux - 28 janv. 2019

    • id

      public String id()
      Description copied from interface: IdentityScope
      The scope identifier, unique within the application context. Uniqueness is guaranteed by a static list recording the scope ids at scope instantiation.
